page.title: 18THE SAXON CENTRE KEMPSTON
page.content: {The Saxon Centre}is a shopping centre owned by Sainsburys,with shops rented out to other firms. The centre has a large{free car park}underneath it.The pavement outside the centre is used for a{variety of events,}including charity collections, information caravans for commercial concerns and local evening classes, and even Father Christmas is found here in December. Next to Sainsbury's 12000 square metre{supermarket}are a{newsagents, a {T.V. and Video Rental shop, a chemist, {a clothes shop, a wine bar, a building {society office and an office block {housing a computer firm.}Sainsburys has 32 tills and employs 400 people. The store has ten sections including grocery, provisions, meat, fish, bakery and beers, wines and spirits.
